intro: Hapalochilus jadunae, commonly known as the Jardine's lily, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern India. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its striking white to pale pink petals and showy inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested habitats and prefers cool, moist conditions. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal. Hapalochilus jadunae is also of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and limited distribution.
